meanings.definition: The attribution of human characteristics to something non-human.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the talking animals were a clever use of personification.
meanings.sent2: The author used personification to make the wind seem like a playful child.
meanings.sent3: The personification of the sun as a smiling face made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a beautiful personification of nature's grace and power.
meanings.sent5: The poet's personification of the moon as a silent watcher was hauntingly beautiful.

meanings.definition: A figure of speech in which a thing, idea, or animal is given human attributes.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement used personification to make the car seem friendly and reliable.
meanings.sent2: In the fable, the talking tree was a clear example of personification.
meanings.sent3: The personification of the storm as an angry giant added a humorous touch to the story.
meanings.sent4: Her painting was a striking personification of loneliness, with a solitary figure under a dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The author's personification of the ocean as a mighty beast brought the scene to life.

meanings.definition: The representation of an abstract quality in human form.
meanings.sent1: The artist's personification of love as a dancing couple was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The play used personification to depict jealousy as a green-eyed monster.
meanings.sent3: The personification of time as an old man with a scythe was both amusing and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent4: Her sculpture was a powerful personification of freedom, with a figure breaking chains.
meanings.sent5: The writer's personification of hope as a guiding light resonated with readers.
